title: Access (2013 - 2020)
info: Canada’s premier library technology conference for librarians, technicians, developers, programmers, and managers. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Sharon Farnel, Kim Martin, William Turkel.

title: Canadian Linked Data Summit (CLDS) (2016)
info: A summit to explore the world of Linked Data and find a path to the future in Canada. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Sharon Farnel.
organizations: University of Alberta;Library and Archives Canada (LAC);McGill University
organization roles: {'University of Alberta': 'Sponsor', 'Library and Archives Canada (LAC)': 'Sponsor', 'McGill University': 'Host'}

title: Canadian Research Data Summit (2019)
info: The a forum for the Canadian research community to develop a shared understanding of the current data management landscape and recommendations for future initiatives.

title: Canadian Research Knowledge Network (CRKN) Conference (2004 - 2020)
info: CRKN advances interconnected, sustainable access to the world's research and to Canada's documentary heritage content. Constance Crompton, Sharon Farnel.

title: Canadian Society of Digital Humanities/Société canadienne des humanités numériques (CSDH/SCHN) (2015 - 2020)
info: CSDH draws together humanists engaged in digital and computer-assisted research, teaching, and creation, and champions interaction between Canadas anglophone and francophone communities. Susan Brown, Constance Crompton, Kim Martin, William Turkel.

title: Code4Lib (2006 - 2020)
info: Code4lib is a volunteer-driven, worldwide collective of hackers, designers, architects, curators, catalogers, artists, and instigators who work for and with libraries, archives, and museums on technology. William Turkel.

title: Decolonizing the Internet (2018 - 2019)
info: Whose Knowledge? convenes marginalized community organizers, technologists, scholars, artists, and Wikimedians to work on issues related to marginalized knowledges on the Internet. Stacy Allison-Cassin.
organizations: Whose Knowledge
organization roles: {'Whose Knowledge': 'Host'}

title: DH LOD-SIG Workshops/Mini-conferences (2005 - 2019)
info: The DH LOD-SIG organizes workshops sponsored by the ADHO. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Constance Crompton, Kim Martin.
organizations: Alliance of Digital Humanities Organizations (ADHO)
organization roles: {'Alliance of Digital Humanities Organizations (ADHO)': 'Sponsor'}

title: DH@Guelph Summer Workshops (2016 - 2020)
info: DH@Guelph provides a forum for colleagues to learn about the digital world and its impact on our work. Constance Crompton, Kim Martin.
organizations: University of Guelph;University of Guelph Library
organization roles: {'University of Guelph': 'Host', 'University of Guelph Library': 'Host'}

title: Digital Diversity Conference (2015)
info: The Digital Diversity Conference examined the trajectory of feminist digital studies, focusing on how varied projects have opened up the objects and methods of literary history and cultural studies. Constance Crompton.

title: Digital Humanities Summer Institute (DHSI) (2001 - 2019)
info: DHSI uses a community-based approach for discussing and learning about new computing technologies and how they are influencing teaching, research, dissemination, creation, and preservation in different disciplines. William Turkel.

title: Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI) International Conference (2001 - 2020)
info: The Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI) supports innovation in metadata design and best practices across the metadata ecology. Sharon Farnel.

title: Implementing New Knowledge Environments (INKE) Meetings/Conferences (2009 - 2020)
info: INKE conferences bring together researchers and stakeholders at the forefront of computing in the humanities, text analysis, information studies, usability and interface design to understand the nature of the human record as it intersects with the computer. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Constance Crompton.

title: In Our Own Words: Decolonizing Description in the Library and Archival Community (2018)
info: In Our Own Words brought together community members, scholars, and cultural heritage workers to commit to active steps toward decolonizing the description of cultural heritage materials. Stacy Allison-Cassin.
organizations: York University Libraries;Ryerson University Library
organization roles: {'York University Libraries': 'Host', 'Ryerson University Library': 'Host'}

title: International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD) (2009 - 2019)
info: KEOD brings together concepts and methods from several computer science domains such as artificial intelligence, databases, expert systems, decision support systems, and information systems. Deb Stacey.

title: International Federation of Library Associations World Library and Information Congress (IFLA WLIC) (1934 - 2019)
LD4 Conferences (2018 - 2020)
info: LD4 brings together a broad range of perspectives, and centers diversity, equity, inclusion, and ethics to create a community of practice for linked data in libraries. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Susan Brown, Sharon Farnel.

title: Linked Pasts Conferences (2015 - 2020)
info: Linked Pasts bring together scholars and practitioners with an interest in Linked Open Data relating to the historical world.

title: LODLAM Summits (2011 - 2020)
info: LODLAM hosts conferences for Linked Open Data in association with Libraries, Archives and Museums. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Susan Brown.
organizations: Getty;Jisc
organization roles: {'Getty': 'Sponsor', 'Jisc': 'Sponsor'}

title: Semantic Web in Libraries (SWIB) (2009 - 2019)
info: SWIB brings together IT staff, developers, librarians, and researchers from over the world to learn about Linked Open Data in libraries and related organizations. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Sharon Farnel.
organizations: Hochschulbibliothekszentrum des Landes Nordrhein-Westfalen (hbz);Leibniz-Informationszentrum Wirtschaft

title: Wikidata Conferences (2017 - 2019)
info: Stacy Allison-Cassin.

title: Canadian Linked Data Initiative (CLDI) (2016 - )
info: The CLDI works cooperatively with libraries to articulate, plan, and find funding for projects that will coordinate the metadata production activities of library technical services units, special collections, and digital libraries in both English and French. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Sharon Farnel.

title: Canadian Writing Research Collaboratory (CWRC) (2011 - )
info: CWRC brings together researchers working with online technologies to investigate writing and related cultural practices relevant to Canada and to the digital turn. Susan Brown, Constance Crompton, Kim Martin, Deb Stacey.
organizations: University of Guelph;University of Alberta
organization roles: {'University of Guelph': 'Institutional Affiliation', 'University of Alberta': 'Institutional Affiliation'}

CHIN: Makers in Canada (2018 - )

Digging into Data Projects
info: Digging into Data Projects addresses how Big Data changes the research landscape for the humanities and social sciences. William Turkel.

title: Linked Data4 (LD4) (2019 - )
info: LD4 investigates concrete ways that linked data benefits GLAM institutions, and it discovesr pathways to participation in linked data. Sharon Farnel.

title: Linked Infrastructure for Networked Cultural Scholarship (LINCS) (2020 - )
info: LINCS will create the conditions to think differently, with machines, about human culture in Canada. Stacy Allison-Cassin, Susan Brown, Sharon Farnel, Kim Martin, Deb Stacey.

info: The Programming Historian publishes novice-friendly, peer-reviewed tutorials to facilitate research and teaching by teaching humanists to use a wide range of digital tools, techniques, and workflows. William Turkel.
